intro: Lophoschoenus hornei, commonly known as the slender swamp grass, is a perennial grass species native to wetland environments in southern Africa. It is characterized by its slender, arching stems and narrow, grass-like leaves that are typically less than 10 centimeters in length. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets, which are clustered at the base of the stems. It thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils and is often found in marshes, swamps, and along the edges of water bodies. Lophoschoenus hornei plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various wetland organisms.
